title: Erigon crash on Goerli test net
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `./erigon --version`
erigon version 2022.99.99-dev-0a5ce152

OS & Version: Linux

Commit hash : 0a5ce152a

#### Expected behaviour
Erigon runs without crashing.

#### Actual behaviour
Erigon crashes.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
Start erigon & rpcdaemon for goerli test net.
```
./build/bin/erigon --datadir /mnt/md0/goerli --chain goerli --private.api.addr=localhost:9091 --port 30304
./build/bin/rpcdaemon --datadir=/mnt/md0/goerli --txpool.api.addr=localhost:9091 --private.api.addr=localhost:9091 --http.api=eth,erigon,web3,net,debug,trace,txpool --http.port 8546
```
`erigon` crashes, but `rpcdaemon` doesn't. I was able to reproduce the following error several times, just by trying to start `erigon`. Eventually, after closing `rpcdaemon`, I was able to restart `erigon` without an exception.

If it matters, I was also running the mainnet at the same time. However, no issues on these two processes:
```
./build/bin/erigon --datadir /mnt/md0/mainnet --chain mainnet --private.api.addr=localhost:9090 --port 30303
./build/bin/rpcdaemon --datadir=/mnt/md0/mainnet --txpool.api.addr=localhost:9090 --private.api.addr=localhost:9090 --http.api=eth,erigon,web3,net,debug,trace,txpool --http.port 8545
```
#### Backtrace

closing due to inactivity. feel free to switch to newer release and create new issue if need

For anyone who finds this issue while searching for this error: try disabling the RPC daemon before restarting Erigon.  This allowed me to bypass the error and recover successfully from the crash.

- Erigon version v2022.06.03
